etymology.description: 姚(姚) (yáo, "handsome; elegant") refers to the surname Yao. 濱(滨) (bīn, "shore; coast") is often used as a given name meaning "shore" or "coast", signifying a connection to nature or elegance.
etymology.interpretation: 姚濱(姚滨) is a common Chinese name, where 姚(姚) (yáo, "handsome; elegant") is a family name, and 濱(滨) (bīn, "shore; coast") is typically a given name that may suggest elegance or a serene, natural beauty.
etymology.simplification: 滨 is the simplified form of 濱.

examples.chinese: 姚滨是一位杰出的科学家(姚濱是一位傑出的科學家)。
examples.pinyin: Yáo Bīn shì yī wèi jié chū de kē xué jiā.
examples.english: Yao Bin is an outstanding scientist.

examples.chinese: 姚滨今年出国访问(姚濱今年出國訪問)，带回了很多珍贵的学术资源(帶回了很多珍貴的學術資源)。
examples.pinyin: Yáo Bīn jīn nián chū guó fǎng wèn, dài huí le hěn duō zhēn guì de xué shù zī yuán.
examples.english: This year, Yao Bin went abroad for an academic visit and brought back many valuable scholarly resources.
